title: BBC Local Live: Sheffield and South Yorkshire on Tuesday 8 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: doncaster death crash trial : car overtook three abreast at 70mph .
uni wins legal battle with students over occupied lecture theatre .
rotherham town centre redevelopment plans put to public .
power station collapse : rotherham man 's uncle says delays 'diabolical ' .
ten empty houses for every homeless person in yorkshire , bbc finds .

text: a cloudy night with outbreaks of rain and hill snow spreading east overnight .
lows of 3c ( 37f ) .
tomorrow will be a cold , cloudy and wet day with some heavy spells of rain across south yorkshire , and also hill snow at times .
highs of 5c ( 41f ) .
spring will be in the air by the weekend - but for how long ?
here 's your 10- day forecast with bbc weather 's sarah keith-lucas :

documents.title: sheffield university successful in legal action against protesting students
text: the university of sheffield has been successful in gaining a possession order after a group of students occupied a lecture theatre for a week .

the university took legal action against a group of its own students who 've been holding a round-the-clock protest at the sir richard roberts building against what they call `` the current assault on higher education '' .
it 's not yet clear what the university will do now it has legally won possession of the lecture theatre .
the university recognises the commitment of the occupiers to peaceful protest , however can not condone occupation of a building that could cause disruption to our staff and students . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

and you can get on board the flying scotsman as the recently-restored locomotive takes to the tracks and celebrates the golden era of steam with this new interactive video feature .

documents.title: your views : yorkshire brass champions do n't need to blow their own trumpet
text: yesterday we heard that stannington brass band are county champions after scooping first place at the yorkshire brass band championships.they 've qualified for the national finals later this year .
you 've been leaving your congratulations on the bbc radio sheffield facebook page :
interesting to see so many younger players keeping the tradition going .
well done and congratulations to all of you . ''
well done stannington brass band ! !
have very happy memories of joint concerts in the 90s and noughties up at the lomas hall .
long may your success continue ! ''
years ago i was in a brass band brodsworth colliery 's a cornet player well done . ''
author: Jenny Cork

documents.title: alcohol consumption : one in 10 yorkshire drinkers bust weekly limit in one day
text: around 2.5 million people in great britain - 9 % of drinkers - consume more than the new weekly recommended limit for alcohol - 14 units - in a single day , latest figures from the office for national statistics show .
in yorkshire and the humber , the figure was slightly higher at 10 % - one of the three english regions to top the national average .
sarah toule , from the world cancer research fund , said : `` when it comes to cancer prevention , people should avoid alcohol as much as possible as any amount increases the risk of cancer .
`` if they are going to drink , it 's important not to binge-drink and have no more than seven drinks a week spread over at least three days . ''

documents.title: film that celebrates upperthorpe to get premiere tonight
text: a film that celebrates the sheffield suburb of upperthorpe gets its premiere tonight .

walk with a cart through upperthorpe will be unveiled by the shared vision project which saw local artists and residents team up with local filmmaker , ian nesbitt ( to explore what makes upperthorpe such a unique place to live .
the project is a partnership between the social housing arts network , south yorkshire housing association and funded by arts council england
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: coming soon : new yorkshire air ambulance under construction
text: work seems to be progressing well on yorkshire air ambulance 's ( yaa ) new helicopter at the airbus factory in munich .
yaa chairman peter sunderland said : `` it has been a long process planning for the replacement of our fleet .
`` however we are confident that we have made the right decision for the people of yorkshire , enabling us to give them the best possible service . ''
the new helicopter will offer yaa paramedics and doctors a larger cabin area in which to treat patients in flight and it will carry the latest medical equipment .
check out our new helicopter !
coming soon !
# visionofthefuture # yaa

documents.title: watch : south yorkshire charity benefits from sport relief
text: there 's just two days until paul and i start our epic 3-legged journey for sport relief , but where does the money raised go ?
in the past few years one charity that 's received almost £ 100,000 from sport relief is the roundabout charity for the homeless in sheffield .
it offers help and support to the city 's young people .
a very special young lady called jade takes up the story
author: Harry Gration
Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: car 'was overtaking ' two others at 70mph before fatal doncaster crash
text: a car was overtaking two others three abreast at 70mph through a village just before it overturned , crashed into the garden of a house and burst into flames , killing two passengers , a jury has been told .

sheffield crown court heard how a black renault megane was overtaking a volkswagen passat , which was already overtaking a car towing a caravan in a 30mph zone seconds before the fatal crash , in branton , near doncaster on 25 august last year .

prosecutor michael slater told a jury how the megane clipped the kerb on the wrong side of doncaster road , losing a back wheel , before demolishing bollards on a central reservation and ending up on its roof in flames in the front garden of a house .
mr slater explained how liam aldred , 26 , and dean mcintyre , 27 , died in the crash .
another man , bradley stevenson , managed to get out of the car , despite being on fire , but was seriously injured and was treated at the roadside .
the prosecutor said two people fled the scene - a 15-year-old boy and james maughan , 21 , who went on trial today .
mr maughan , of marshland road , doncaster , denies two counts of causing death by dangerous driving .
he also denies a further charge of causing serious injury by dangerous driving .
the trial continues .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: sheffield university takes protesting students to court
text: sheffield university are in court today to gain a possession order after a group of students have occupied a lecture theatre for a week .
the students have occupied the richard roberts auditorium to protest against what they say is `` the current assault on higher education . ''
the university says it recognises the commitment of the occupiers to peaceful protest , but it can not condone occupation of a building that could cause disruption to our staff and students .
author: Rebecca Kerry
Journalist, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: international women 's day recognised by south yorkshire fire and rescue

text: in just 48 hours bbc look north 's paul hudson and i begin our sport relief challenge .
we set off from all saints square , rotherham , on thursday and will walk over 110 miles around yorkshire tied together at the ankle .
what could possibly go wrong ?
here 's a look at where we 'll be on thursday .
it 'd be great to see you along the way !
you can see more information about our three-legged challenge here .

Presenter, BBC Look North

text: liam aldred , 26 , and dean mcintyre , 27 , both from doncaster , died in the crash in poppyfields way , branton , on 25 august .
trial starts of james maughan who denies being the driver of a car which crashed near doncaster last august killing 2 rear seat passengers

documents.title: watch : snapshot of barnsley town centre redevelopment
text: if you have n't been in barnsley town centre recently , things are changing in a big way
the council is backing a major scheme to transform the markets area .
the project was first planned more than a decade ago but the global financial crash left it without backing .
work has been under way for some time now and will continue for a few years yet ; here 's a video of work ongoing today .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: south yorkshire police to replace call system after concerns about waiting time
text: south yorkshire police are going to replace the call system for their non-emergency number .
it was revealed by the bbc last week that people are having to wait longer to get through to the 101 number .
in south yorkshire the time taken to answer calls tripled to just under a minute and a half last year .
it 's thought the new it system which should help the problem will cost around £ 12m .
more with me at 13:30 on bbc look north .
author: Nicola Hudson
Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: rotherham man 'may hold vital information ' after armed bank robbery
text: police are trying to trace a rotherham man in connection with an armed bank robbery in the town .
officers believe paul smith , 44 , could hold `` vital information '' about the incident at the yorkshire bank in parkgate .
at around 8.50am on friday 29 january , police were called to broad street after reports that two men entered the bank and threatened staff with firearms .
michael lydon , 51 , from cleethorpes , has been charged with robbery , attempted robbery , firearms offences and dangerous driving .
he was remanded to appear at sheffield crown court on 31 march .
we have already charged mr lydon and arrested and bailed five people in connection with this incident but we believe that paul smith could hold vital information . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: is your dog chipped ? new rules from 6 april for all dog owners
text: dog owners in england are being reminded that they will have to microchip their animal from 6 april this year under plans intended to cut a rise in the number of strays .
the microchips are coded with owners ' details and those who do not comply could face fines of up to £ 500 .

barnsley council has teamed up with dogs trust to offer a series of free microchipping sessions with the next event taking place at carlton community centre , park street , carlton , from 11am-3pm tomorrow .
dogs will be treated on a first come , first served basis .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: sheffield hospital consultant investigated over scarf row
text: a hospital consultant is under investigation over comments he made about a muslim surgeon who wore a headscarf in an operating theatre .
dr vladislav rogozov , a consultant anaesthetist at sheffield 's royal hallamshire hospital , spoke about the incident in an online blog .
he said he had confronted the unnamed surgeon when he realised she intended to keep the scarf on during surgery .
hospital chiefs would not confirm if dr rogozov had been suspended .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: do you recognise the women in these cctv images ?
text: police want your help to identify the two women in these cctv images .
officers are keen to speak to the women in relation to an `` altercation '' in barnsley town centre on saturday 13 february as they could have information which would help the investigation .
a 20-year-old woman was arrested in connection with the incident on sus of affray and later bailed , police said .
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: didcot power station collapse : rescue attempts criticised
text: two of the three families of missing workers feared trapped at the collapsed didcot power station have criticised emergency services ' rescue attempts .
jade ali , 28 , said she had been `` left in the dark '' about the search for partner christopher huxtable , 34 .

john howley , the uncle of rotherham-based demolition worker ken cresswell , who is also believed to be trapped in the rubble , said there had been a `` diabolical '' delay in getting to the missing men .
it is just the uncertainty - you are hoping that they are still alive in there , but you have got to be realistic and think that it has been going on too long now . ''
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: watch : anti-social behaviour in barnsley

police have been targeting the behaviour in kendray , but as you can see , yobs are ruling the area
